meanings.sent1: She arbitraged by buying and selling stocks to make a profit.
meanings.sent2: Traders often arbitraged between different markets to take advantage of price differences.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel arbitraged by collecting nuts in one area and burying them in another for later.
meanings.sent4: His ability to arbitraged in the business world made him a master of financial strategy.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was like a skilled player who arbitraged the audience's attention effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Arbitraged (adjective): relating to or characteristic of arbitrage
meanings.sent1: The arbitraged market showed fluctuations in prices throughout the day.
meanings.sent2: Investors studied the arbitraged opportunities to make informed decisions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's behavior was so arbitraged, always finding the best spot for napping.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in an arbitraged manner, always seeking the most efficient solution.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky in an arbitraged palette of colors, creating a breathtaking view.
